articles.title: Outgoing FBI director calls China and its cyber program the ‘defining threat of our generation'
articles.summary: Christopher Wray, who's served as FBI director since 2017, is set to step down before President-elect Donald Trump is inaugurated on Jan. 21, 2025. Wray described the Chinese government as 'the greatest-long-term threat' and the 'defining threat of our generation' due in part to its massive, state-funded cyber program. He said Beijing can leverage those programs to target water treatment plants, the electrical grid, natural gas pipelines, telecommunications and other systems. China has been accused of state-sponsored hacking campaigns aimed at the U.S. and other countries, but it denies involvement.
